markdownRemark.html:
This is the first time where I actually recap my year and write about it. So let’s see what 2018 was like for me…

React, React & React

2018 was basically the year where I just fell in love with React. I tried to learn as many things I could and tried to encourage my colleagues at work to use it. It’s just incredible how easy you can bootstrap a project and incrementally add new stuff on top of it. The API is straight forward and more advanced features are easily learned. And I think it’s what the core team also cares about. Simplicity. I remember Brian Holt telling on Frontend Masters that when he made a rewrite of a part at Reddit in React, he went to vacation after the rewrite. In vacation, he was unreachable and the software broke. But one of the backend developers was able to understand the code by reading it and fix the software without really knowing React or Javascript.
